message.content:
cs.NE, cs.CL, cs.LG, cs.CV, cs.AI

This paper deals with the problem of learning long-term dependencies in recurrent neural networks, which is a common topic in the field of neural networks and machine learning. The use of rectified linear units and the initialization of the recurrent weight matrix are also key components of the proposed solution. Therefore, the most likely sub-category is cs.NE (Neural and Evolutionary Computing). However, the paper also mentions language modeling and speech recognition, which suggests that it could also belong to cs.CL (Computation and Language) and cs.CV (Computer Vision and Pattern Recognition). Additionally, the use of optimization techniques and network architectures could place it in cs.LG (Machine Learning) and cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence).
